description.raw:
This pull request will allow the gazebo_1.9 branch to compile under Mac OS X. There are still bugs (notably #800, #802), and I haven't verified that all tests pass, but it's a start.

This pull request includes an assortment of compilation fixes, warning fixes for default apple compiler, and fixes for regression tests. There's no API changes, so it should be safe for 1.9.

To test on osx, you'll first need the xcode developer tools. These can be downloaded from the App Store or the [Apple developer website](https://developer.apple.com).

You'll also need to get the dependencies, and [Homebrew](http://brew.sh) is the easiest way to get them.
~~~
# To install homebrew:
ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/mxcl/homebrew/go)"
# Update your list of formula
brew update
# The following will warn you if there are problems with your configuration
# and possibly recommend changes
brew doctor
# Use custom formulae from ROS for some dependencies
brew tap ros/groovy
# or equivalently
brew tap ros/hydro
# install the dependencies
brew install `brew deps --1 gazebo`
~~~

title: OSX support for gazebo 1.9
